function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Drastic climate change due to reduction of human dominancy in environment","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High air pollution levels at home due to covid-19 and reduction of outdoor activities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wild animals leaving their natural habitat and moving into urban areas in search of food","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conflict and competition among wild animals in urban areas","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Nature rejuvenation leading to potential disruption of ecosystems","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential rebound in no2 emissions and other pollutants after relaxation of covid-19 regulations revenge pollution","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Climate recovery may be temporary or reversed due to economic activities returning to normal","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Demand for regular lockdowns to manage environmental risks in countries like qatar","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid spread of infectious diseases through wildlife trafficking and deforestation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overexploitation of nature and neglect of environmental protection","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unsustainable business practices leading to environmental harm","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of virus on particulate particles in severely air pollute area","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cleaner air due to lockdowns against coronavirus","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus has different survival times on different surfaces, posing a risk of surface transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive correlation between covid-19 infection and air pollution, leading to increased morbidity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Propagation and infection of coronavirus impacted by environmental factors such as temperature and humidity.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced human movement due to lockdowns","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Climatic data gaps due to covid-19 outbreak","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased pollution in city air and water bodies","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Noise pollution affecting n100 million people in europe, leading to stress, elevated blood pressure, and other health issues.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Chronic traffic noise hazardous to birds, leading to embryo mortality and growth issues in zebra finches.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"International flights almost standing still due to lockdowns, reducing noise pollution from air traffic.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased threat to wildlife in poorer countries due to decreased economic capacity in pandemic areas, leading to difficulties in conserving endangered species and habitats.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased conflict between wildlife and urban areas due to human absence during lockdowns, leading to potential harm to both wildlife and humans.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on intermittent social lockdowns to nurture nature may disrupt human livelihoods and economic stability, especially in resource-dependent communities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased movement of wildlife in human-dominated areas","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in human activity leading to wildlife encroachment","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced traffic leading to lower road kill cases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased spread of contagious diseases due to human-wildlife interaction","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced focus on environmental protection and conservation","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in airborne disease transmission due to improved air quality","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction of co2 emissions due to lockdown measures","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in job losses due to lockdown and economic downturn","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of rebound in co2 emissions after lockdown is lifted","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in emissions leading to improved air quality","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of lockdown on pollution levels in major cities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Temporary reduction in co2 and no2 emissions due to lockdown","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in no2 emissions due to risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of cov-19 and social lockdowns leading to changes in environmental indices","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction of nitrogen dioxide no2 emissions due to industrial and vehicular operations coming to a halt during the pandemic","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Radical drop in no2
